feed.title: Google Cloud: BigQuery
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: BigQuery

entry.content:
You can now customize the scope of data documentation scans for BigQuery tables to generate specific insights. You can choose to generate only SQL queries, only table and column descriptions, or all insights.

You can also create one-time data scans that execute immediately upon creation, removing the need for a separate run command. These scans support a Time to Live (TTL) setting to automatically delete the scan resource after completion.

For more information, see Generate insights for a BigQuery table.
entry.summary: Enhance your BigQuery data documentation with customizable scans. You can now select specific insights like SQL queries or descriptions, and create one-time scans with automatic cleanup via TTL. This allows for more targeted and efficient data analysis.
entry.title: Feature: Customize BigQuery Data Documentation Scans

entry.content: Data transfers from the YouTube Channel and YouTube Content Owner data sources now support reach reports. For more information, see YouTube Channel report transformation and YouTube Content Owner report transformation.
entry.summary: Reach reports are now supported for data transfers from YouTube Channel and YouTube Content Owner. This update provides more detailed insights into your YouTube data. For more information, refer to the updated documentation on report transformations.
entry.title: Change: YouTube data transfer enhancements

entry.content: You can now associate data policies directly on columns. This feature enables direct database administration for controlling access and applying masking and transformation rules at the column level. This feature is now generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now associate data policies directly on columns in BigQuery. This feature, now generally available, enables database administrators to control access and apply masking and transformation rules at the column level.
entry.title: Feature: Column-level data policies now available

entry.content: Gemini in BigQuery now processes data in the same jurisdiction (US or EU) as your BigQuery datasets, or based upon user-specified location settings. For more information, see Where Gemini BigQuery processes your data.
entry.summary: Gemini in BigQuery now respects data residency, processing data within your BigQuery dataset's jurisdiction (US or EU) or according to your location settings. This ensures your data stays where you expect it to be.
entry.title: Announcement: Gemini BigQuery Data Residency

entry.content:
You can now pass parameterized queries from the BigQuery query editor in the Google Cloud console.

This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now use parameterized queries directly from the BigQuery query editor in the Google Cloud console. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Parameterized queries in BigQuery editor

entry.content:
BigQuery now supports a RANDOM_HASH predefined masking rule. This rule returns a hash of the column's value using a salted hash algorithm, and it provides stronger security than the standard Hash (SHA-256) rule.

For more information, see Data masking rules.
entry.summary: BigQuery has introduced a new predefined masking rule, RANDOM_HASH. This rule offers enhanced security by hashing column values with a salted algorithm, providing a more robust alternative to the standard SHA-256 hash.
entry.title: Feature: New data masking rule available in BigQuery

entry.content: BigQuery now offers conversational analytics, which accelerates data analysis by enabling insights through natural language. Users can view a predefined sample agent, chat with their BigQuery data or custom agents, and access those agents even outside of BigQuery. They can also use supported BigQuery ML functions in verified queries and in chat. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Analyze your BigQuery data faster with conversational analytics. Ask questions in natural language to gain insights, and use supported BigQuery ML functions in chat. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Conversational Analytics for BigQuery

entry.content:
You can now create BigQuery ML models by using the Google Cloud console.

This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now create BigQuery ML models directly within the Google Cloud console. This feature is now generally available, simplifying the process of building machine learning models with BigQuery.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery ML models now available in the console

entry.content: The BigQuery change data capture feature has been renamed to BigQuery change data capture ingestion.
entry.summary: The BigQuery change data capture feature has been renamed to BigQuery change data capture ingestion. This change aims to clarify the functionality and improve discoverability of this feature within BigQuery.
entry.title: Change: BigQuery CDC Renamed

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from Shopify to BigQuery. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now transfer data from Shopify to BigQuery using the BigQuery Data Transfer Service. This new feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Shopify data transfer to BigQuery available

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from Mailchimp to BigQuery. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now transfer data from Mailchimp to BigQuery using the BigQuery Data Transfer Service. This new feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Mailchimp data transfer to BigQuery

entry.content: An updated version of the Simba JDBC driver for BigQuery is now available.
entry.summary: An updated version of the Simba JDBC driver for BigQuery has been released. This new version offers improvements and bug fixes for enhanced performance and stability.
entry.title: Change: New Simba JDBC driver available

entry.content: You can now use Gemini Cloud Assist to discover resources across your projects. For example, you can ask about a specific table's schema, or which tables contain demographic information about new users. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Gemini Cloud Assist now allows you to discover resources across your projects. You can ask questions about table schemas or specific data types. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Discover resources with Gemini Cloud Assist

entry.content: You can now optionally specify which model to use by passing an endpoint argument to the AI.IF, AI.SCORE, and AI.CLASSIFY functions.
entry.summary: You can now specify the exact model you want to use with the AI.IF, AI.SCORE, and AI.CLASSIFY functions by passing an endpoint argument. This provides more control over your AI model selections.
entry.title: Change: Choose your AI model

entry.content: You can now run queries that use the AI.IF, AI.SCORE, and AI.CLASSIFY functions by using your end-user credentials instead of a BigQuery connection.
entry.summary: You can now run queries using AI.IF, AI.SCORE, and AI.CLASSIFY functions with your end-user credentials. This change offers more flexibility in how you interact with these powerful AI capabilities.
entry.title: Change: New options for AI functions in BigQuery

entry.content: Support for table parameters in table-valued functions is restored.
entry.summary: Support for table parameters in table-valued functions has been restored. This fix ensures that table parameters can be correctly used within table functions.
entry.title: Fixed: Table function table parameters restored

entry.content: You can now use Gemini Cloud Assist to get information about your job history, such as why a particular query was slow or which queries were the most resource-intensive in the past day. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Gemini Cloud Assist now helps you understand your job history. You can analyze past queries to identify performance bottlenecks and resource usage. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini Cloud Assist: Job History Insights

entry.content: BigQuery is now available in the Bangkok (asia-southeast3) region.
entry.summary: BigQuery is now available in the Bangkok region (asia-southeast3). This expansion brings BigQuery's powerful data warehousing capabilities closer to customers in Southeast Asia.
entry.title: Change: BigQuery now in Bangkok

entry.content: Dataform workflows, BigQuery notebooks, pipelines, and data preparations are enforcing strict act-as mode at the project level. To avoid failures and maintain automatic releases, you must use custom service accounts instead of the default Dataform service agent across all repositories. You must also grant the Service Account User role (roles/iam.serviceAccountUser) to the default Dataform service agent and relevant principals. For more information and to verify act-as permissions, see Use strict act-as mode.
entry.summary: Strict act-as mode is now enforced for Dataform workflows, BigQuery notebooks, pipelines, and data preparations at the project level. To prevent failures, update your repositories to use custom service accounts instead of the default Dataform service agent and grant the Service Account User role to the Dataform service agent and other relevant principals.
entry.title: Breaking: Action Required: Update Dataform Service Accounts

entry.content: You can now use the Google-developed, open source Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) driver for BigQuery to connect your Java applications to BigQuery. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Connect your Java applications to BigQuery using the new open-source JDBC driver. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery JDBC driver for Java now available

entry.content:
The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE and LOAD DATA statements now support the following options:

  • time_zone: specify a time zone to use when loading data
  • date_format, datetime_format, time_format, and timestamp_format: define how date and time values are formatted in your source files
  • null_markers: define the strings that represent NULL values in CSV files.
  • source_column_match: specify how loaded columns are matched to the schema. You can match columns by position or by name.

These features are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery's CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE and LOAD DATA statements now support advanced options for handling time zones, date and time formats, null markers, and column matching. These features are now generally available, offering more flexibility and control over your data loading processes.
entry.title: Feature: New data loading options for BigQuery

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from PostgreSQL to BigQuery. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now transfer data from PostgreSQL to BigQuery. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Transfer PostgreSQL data to BigQuery

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from Microsoft SQL Server to BigQuery. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports transferring data from Microsoft SQL Server to BigQuery. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: SQL Server data transfer to BigQuery available

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from MySQL to BigQuery. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now transfer data from MySQL to BigQuery. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: MySQL data transfer to BigQuery now available

entry.content: You can now use the BigQuery Data Transfer Service to transfer data from blob storage sources, such as Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3), Azure Blob Storage, and Cloud Storage, into BigLake Iceberg tables in BigQuery. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports transferring data from blob storage sources like Amazon S3 and Azure Blob Storage into BigLake Iceberg tables. This new feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Data Transfer Service for Iceberg Tables

entry.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from the following data sources to BigQuery:

  • Klaviyo
  • HubSpot

These features are in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports data transfers from Klaviyo and HubSpot. These new features are currently in Preview. This allows you to easily move your marketing data into BigQuery for analysis.
entry.title: Feature: New Data Sources Available in BigQuery Transfer Service

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from Oracle to BigQuery. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports transferring data from Oracle to BigQuery. This feature is now generally available, allowing for seamless integration.
entry.title: Feature: Oracle data transfer to BigQuery

entry.content:
You can now use the BigQuery remote MCP server to enable LLM agents to perform a range of data-related tasks.

This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery remote MCP server is now available in preview, allowing LLM agents to perform various data-related tasks. This new feature enables more advanced data analysis and manipulation directly through AI agents.
entry.title: Feature: LLM agents can now query BigQuery data

entry.content:
You can now enable autonomous embedding generation on tables that you make with the CREATE TABLE statement. When you do this, BigQuery maintains a column of embeddings on the table based on a source column. When you add or modify data in the source column, BigQuery automatically generates or updates the embedding column for that data.

You can also use the AI.SEARCH function, enabling semantic search on tables that have autonomous embedding generation enabled.

These features are in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports autonomous embedding generation for tables created with the `CREATE TABLE` statement. This feature automatically maintains an embeddings column based on a source column, updating embeddings as data changes. Additionally, the `AI.SEARCH` function enables semantic search on tables with this feature enabled. These capabilities are currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Autonomous Embedding Generation

entry.content: An updated version of the ODBC driver for BigQuery is now available.
entry.summary: A new version of the ODBC driver for BigQuery has been released. This update includes the latest improvements and bug fixes for enhanced performance and stability when connecting to BigQuery.
entry.title: Change: Updated BigQuery ODBC driver released

entry.content: Search results in the Explorer pane in BigQuery Studio now show results in the current organization. You can use a drop-down menu to switch between organizations. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Search results in BigQuery Studio now show results in the current organization. You can use a drop-down menu to switch between organizations.
entry.title: Feature: Search results now in current organization

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports incremental data transfers when transferring data from Salesforce to BigQuery. This feature is supported in Preview.
entry.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports incremental data transfers from Salesforce to BigQuery. This feature is available in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Incremental data transfers from Salesforce to BigQuery now in Preview

entry.content: An updated version of the JDBC driver for BigQuery is now available.
entry.summary: An updated version of the JDBC driver for BigQuery has been released. This new version includes improvements and bug fixes for a better user experience.
entry.title: Change: New BigQuery JDBC Driver Available

entry.content: You can set the default project and dataset for your pipeline in the SQLX options section, which simplifies task configuration by using these defaults for all tasks. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Set default project and dataset for your pipeline in SQLX options to simplify task configuration. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Default Project and Dataset for Pipelines

entry.content: You can now use the BigQuery Agent Analytics plugin within the Agent Development Kit to export agent interaction data directly into BigQuery. This plugin captures comprehensive logs of your agent's prompts, tool usage, and responses, enabling you to analyze and visualize agent performance metrics. The plugin leverages the BigQuery Storage Write API for efficient high-throughput streaming. For more information on how to leverage this plugin in your agent, see the Announcing BigQuery Agent Analytics for the Google ADK.
entry.summary: Export agent interaction data to BigQuery using the new Agent Analytics plugin in the Agent Development Kit. Analyze performance with comprehensive logs and efficient data streaming.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery Agent Analytics Plugin

entry.content: You can now use Gemini in BigQuery to fix and explain errors in your SQL queries. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now use Gemini in BigQuery to fix and explain errors in your SQL queries. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini in BigQuery Now Available

entry.content: You can use the JSON_FLATTEN function to extract all non-array values that are either directly in the input JSON value or children of one or more consecutively nested arrays in the input JSON value. This function is available in Preview.
entry.summary: Extract non-array values from JSON with nested arrays.
entry.title: Feature: New JSON_FLATTEN function

entry.content: Dataform now lets you automate the creation of BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Dataform now allows you to automate the creation of BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This new feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Dataform now supports Apache Iceberg tables in BigQuery

entry.content:
BigQuery ML now supports the following generative AI functions:

  • AI.GENERATE: generate free text to accomplish a wide range of tasks, such as translation, summarization, and classification, on any unstructured data, including images, audio, video, and documents. It can also perform entity extraction and generate structured output. This function is generally available (GA).
  • AI.EMBED: turn text, image, audio, video, or documents into embeddings. This function is in Preview.
  • AI.SIMILARITY: compute the semantic similarity between pairs of text, pairs of images, or across text and images. This function is in Preview.
  • You can use the AI.GENERATE_BOOL, AI.GENERATE_DOUBLE, and AI.GENERATE_INT functions to generate scalar values, which are convenient for filtering, scoring, and counting purposes.
  • Each of these functions supports authentication with end-user credentials (EUC) to set up the necessary Vertex AI permissions.

BigQuery ML now supports the following table-valued generative AI functions:

  • AI.GENERATE_TABLE: generate a table of structured output from unstructured data including text, images, audio, and video.
  • AI.GENERATE_TEXT is the new, preferred version of ML.GENERATE_TEXT, which has the same functionality but with simplified column output names.
  • AI.GENERATE_EMBEDDING is the new, preferred version of ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING, which has the same functionality but with simplified column output names.
  • These functions are all generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery ML now offers a suite of powerful generative AI functions, including AI.GENERATE for text and structured output, AI.EMBED for creating embeddings from various data types, and AI.SIMILARITY for semantic comparisons. These enhancements allow for advanced natural language processing and data analysis directly within BigQuery, with support for end-user credentials for secure access. The update also introduces table-valued functions like AI.GENERATE_TABLE and preferred versions of text and embedding generation functions.
entry.title: Feature: New Generative AI Functions in BigQuery ML

entry.content:
You can now use Gemini 3.0 when you call generative AI functions in BigQuery, such as AI.GENERATE. You must use the full global endpoint argument:

https://aiplatform.googleapis.com/v1/projects/PROJECT_ID/locations/global/publishers/google/models/gemini-3-pro-preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports Gemini 3.0 for generative AI functions. Use the full global endpoint for integration.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini 3.0 in BigQuery

entry.content: You can now publish data insights, including query recommendations and auto-generated table and column descriptions, to the Dataplex Universal Catalog. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now publish data insights, including query recommendations and auto-generated table and column descriptions, to the Dataplex Universal Catalog. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Data Insights Now Available in Dataplex Universal Catalog

entry.content: In the query execution graph, you can now use the query text heatmap to identify which query text contributes to stages that consume more slot time, and to see query plan details for those stages. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Identify query text contributing to slot time consumption using the new query text heatmap in the query execution graph. This feature, currently in Preview, allows you to view query plan details for time-consuming stages.
entry.title: Feature: Query text heatmap for query execution graph

entry.content: You can use folders to organize and control access to single file code assets, such as notebooks, saved queries, data canvases, and data preparation files. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Use folders to organize and control access to single file code assets like notebooks, saved queries, and more. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Organize code assets with folders

entry.content: You can now share SQL stored procedures in BigQuery sharing listings and enable role-based authorization for stored procedures. These features are in preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery now allows sharing SQL stored procedures and managing role-based authorization for them. These features are currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Share SQL stored procedures in BigQuery

entry.content: The BigQuery Overview page is now your hub for discovering tutorials, features, and resources to help you get the most out of BigQuery. It provides guided paths for users of all skill levels. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: The BigQuery Overview page is a new hub for tutorials, features, and resources, offering guided paths for all users. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery Overview Page Now Available

entry.content:
You can now use the interactive SQL translator, the translation API, and the batch SQL translator to translate the following SQL dialects into GoogleSQL:

  • Apache Impala SQL
  • GoogleSQL (BigQuery)

Impala SQL translation can be used to migrate Cloudera and Apache Hadoop SQL workloads that use Impala as a query engine.

GoogleSQL (BigQuery) translation can be used to verify and iteratively customize your translated SQL queries after an initial translation from an external dialect. For example, you can apply systematic query rewrites using YAML configurations to customize and optimize your GoogleSQL queries before deploying it.

These features are in Preview.
entry.summary: Translate Impala SQL and GoogleSQL to GoogleSQL with new tools.
entry.title: Feature: SQL translator

entry.content: You can now use custom constraints with an Organization Policy to provide more granular control over specific fields for BigQuery dataset resources. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now use custom constraints with Organization Policy for more granular control over BigQuery dataset resources. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Custom Constraints for BigQuery Datasets are Generally Available

entry.content: You can aggregate and deduplicate table data with Gemini assistance in your BigQuery data preparations. These features are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now aggregate and deduplicate your table data with Gemini assistance in BigQuery data preparations. These features are generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Aggregate and Deduplicate Table Data

entry.content: BigQuery ML now offers the AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES function. Use the AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES function with a TimesFM model to detect anomalies in time series data, using historical data as a baseline. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: The AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES function is now available in BigQuery ML for detecting anomalies in time series data. It uses historical data as a baseline and is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES function

entry.content: BigQuery ML now supports the TimesFM 2.5 time series foundational model. You can use the TimesFM 2.5 model in the AI.FORECAST, AI.EVALUATE, and AI.DETECT_ANOMALIES functions to achieve better forecasting accuracy and lower latency.
entry.summary: BigQuery ML has integrated the TimesFM 2.5 foundational model, enhancing forecasting capabilities.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery ML Now Supports TimesFM 2.5

entry.content: Partitioning is now available for BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Partitioning is now available for BigLake tables for Apache Iceberg in BigQuery. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Partitioning for BigLake Tables

entry.content: The research paper ARIMA_PLUS: Large-scale, Accurate, Automatic and Interpretable In-Database Time Series Forecasting and Anomaly Detection in Google BigQuery is now publicly available. This paper describes the algorithms behind the ARIMA_PLUS and ARIMA_PLUS_XREG models for time series forecasting and anomaly detection, and demonstrates the high performance, scalability, explainability, and customizability of the models.
entry.summary: A new research paper details ARIMA Plus, a novel system for time series forecasting and anomaly detection within Google BigQuery. The paper highlights its performance, scalability, and interpretability.
entry.title: Announcement: ARIMA Plus in BigQuery

entry.content: You can now generate data insights when you create a DataScan using the Dataplex API. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now generate data insights when you create a DataScan using the Dataplex API. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Data Insights Now Available

entry.content: You can now generate table and column descriptions in all supported Gemini languages when you generate data insights. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now generate table and column descriptions in all supported Gemini languages when generating data insights. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Generate Descriptions in All Supported Gemini Languages

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service for Google Ads now supports Google Ads API v21.
entry.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service for Google Ads now supports Google Ads API v21.
entry.title: Announcement: Google Ads API v21 Support

entry.content: You can use the MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause in your SQL queries to filter and aggregate matches across rows in a table. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause is now generally available for use in SQL queries.
entry.title: Feature: MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause in SQL

entry.content: You can now use custom organization policies with the BigQuery migration service to allow or deny specific operations during a BigQuery migration to meet your organization's compliance and security requirements. This includes an option to disable AI suggestions during a migration. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now use custom organization policies with the BigQuery migration service to allow or deny specific operations during a BigQuery migration. This feature, which is in Preview, helps meet your organization's compliance and security requirements and includes an option to disable AI suggestions during a migration.
entry.title: Feature: Custom organization policies for BigQuery migration now available

entry.content: We have increased the row capacity for pivot tables backed by BigQuery in Connected Sheets from 100,000 to 200,000 rows.
entry.summary: The row capacity for BigQuery-backed pivot tables in Connected Sheets has been increased from 100,000 to 200,000 rows.
entry.title: Feature: Pivot table row capacity doubled for Connected Sheets

entry.content: The Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore is now generally available (GA) with several new features, including BigQuery catalog federation, credential vending, and catalog management in the Google Cloud console.
entry.summary: The Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore has reached general availability. This feature now includes BigQuery catalog federation, credential vending, and catalog management directly within the Google Cloud console.
entry.title: Feature: Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore is now GA

entry.content: You can now group reservations together to prioritize idle slot sharing within the group. Reservations within a reservation group share idle slots with each other before making them available to other reservations in the project, giving you more control over slot allocation for high-priority workloads. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now group reservations together to prioritize idle slot sharing within the group.
entry.title: Feature: Reservation Groups for Prioritizing Workloads

entry.content: Subscriber email logging lets you log the principal identifiers of users who execute jobs and queries against linked datasets. You can enable logging at the listing level and the data exchange level. The logged data is available in the job_principal_subject field of the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SHARED_DATASET_USAGE view. This feature is generally available.
entry.summary: New feature: subscriber email logging is now available. This allows you to log the principal identifiers of users who execute jobs and queries against linked datasets. You can enable this feature at the listing or data exchange level.
entry.title: Feature: Subscriber email logging

entry.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from the following data sources:

  • Facebook Ads
  • Salesforce
  • Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • ServiceNow

Transfers from these data sources are now generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports data transfers from Facebook Ads, Salesforce, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, and ServiceNow. These integrations are now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: New Data Sources Available in BigQuery Data Transfer Service

entry.content: You can now use the Data Engineering Agent to use Gemini in BigQuery to build and modify data pipelines to ingest data into BigQuery. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Use the new Data Engineering Agent with Gemini in BigQuery to build and modify data pipelines for ingesting data.
entry.title: Feature: Introducing the Data Engineering Agent

entry.content:
The administrative jobs explorer now includes a job details page to help you diagnose and troubleshoot queries. The Performance tab compiles query information including the execution graph, SQL text, execution history, performance variance, and system load during execution. You can also compare two jobs to identify discrepancies and potential areas to improve query performance.

This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: A new job details page is now available in the administrative jobs explorer to help diagnose and troubleshoot queries. It includes performance information, execution details, and the ability to compare jobs for performance improvement.
entry.title: Feature: New Job Details Page for Query Troubleshooting

entry.content:
BigQuery now offers the following managed AI functions that use Gemini to help you filter, join, rank, and classify your data:

  • AI.IF: Filter and join text or multimodal data based on a condition described in natural language.
  • AI.SCORE: Rate text or multimodal input to rank your data by quality, similarity, or other criteria.
  • AI.CLASSIFY: Classify text into user-defined categories.

These functions are in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery now offers managed AI functions that leverage Gemini for data manipulation tasks like filtering, joining, ranking, and classification.
entry.title: Feature: Introducing AI Functions in BigQuery

entry.content: You can now use the Apache Arrow format to stream data to BigQuery with the Storage Write API. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now use the Apache Arrow format to stream data to BigQuery with the Storage Write API. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Apache Arrow format support for BigQuery Storage Write API

entry.content: BigQuery is now offering early access to conversational analytics. Conversational analytics accelerates data analysis by enabling quick insights through natural language. Users can chat with their BigQuery data, create custom agents, and access those agents even outside of BigQuery. To enroll in conversational analytics early access, fill out the request form.
entry.summary: BigQuery introduces conversational analytics for faster data insights using natural language. Users can interact with data, build custom agents, and access them outside of BigQuery.
entry.title: Feature: Conversational Analytics in BigQuery

entry.content: You can now use custom constraints with Organization Policy to provide more granular control over specific fields for some BigQuery sharing resources. For more information, see Manage Sharing data exchanges and listings using custom constraints. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Organization Policy now supports custom constraints for more granular control over specific fields in BigQuery sharing resources. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Granular control for BigQuery sharing

entry.content: Support for table parameters in table-value functions (TVFs) has been temporarily disabled. We are working to restore this feature as soon as possible.
entry.summary: Support for table parameters in table-value functions (TVFs) has been temporarily disabled. We are working to restore this feature as soon as possible.
entry.title: Issue: Table parameters in TVFs temporarily disabled

entry.content:
BigQuery ML now offers a built-in TimesFM univariate time series forecasting model that implements Google Research's open source TimesFM model. You can use BigQuery ML's built-in TimesFM model with the following functions:

  • Use AI.FORECAST to perform forecasting. This function now supports a larger context window.
  • Use AI.EVALUATE to evaluate forecasted data against a reference time series based on historical data.

To try using a TimesFM model with the AI.FORECAST function, see Forecast a time series with a TimesFM univariate model.

This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery ML now includes a built-in TimesFM model for univariate time series forecasting. This feature, which is now generally available, allows you to use the AI.FORECAST and AI.EVALUATE functions for more robust forecasting capabilities.
entry.title: Feature: TimesFM Univariate Time Series Forecasting Model

entry.content: BigQuery now supports TransUnion for entity resolution. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports TransUnion for entity resolution. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Entity Resolution support in BigQuery

entry.content:
You can now use visualization cells to automatically generate a visualization of any DataFrame in your notebook. You can customize the columns, chart type, aggregations, colors , labels, and title.

This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Generate visualizations from DataFrames in your notebook.
entry.title: Feature: Visualization cells

entry.content:
In BigQuery ML, you can now fully manage open models as Vertex AI endpoints. BigQuery-managed open models offer the following benefits:

  • Manage Vertex AI resource by using SQL queries
  • Automatic or immediate open model undeployment to save costs
  • Customize model deployment machine types or reserve open model resources by using Compute Engine reservations

This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery ML now supports managing open models as Vertex AI endpoints, offering benefits like SQL-based resource management, cost-saving auto-undeployment, and customizable deployment options.
entry.title: Feature: Manage open models in BigQuery ML

entry.content:
The following features are now generally available (GA) in BigQuery Studio:

  • To streamline resource discovery and access, the left Explorer pane has been reorganized into three sections: Explorer, Classic Explorer, and Git repository. You can still use the Classic Explorer, which provides the complete resources tree.
  • In the Explorer pane, you can use the search feature to find BigQuery resources in your organization. The results appear in a new tab in the details pane. You can use filters to narrow your search.
  • You can access job histories by clicking Job history in the Explorer pane. A new tab opens that displays a list of job histories. BigQuery Studio no longer has a bottom pane for job history.
  • To reduce tab proliferation, clicking a resource opens it within the same tab. To open the resource in a separate tab, press Ctrl (or Command on macOS) and click the resource. To prevent the current tab from getting its content replaced, double-click the tab. The name changes from italicized to regular font. If you still lose your resource, you can click tab_recent Recent tabs in the details pane to find the resource.
  • You can use breadcrumbs to navigate through different tabs and resources in the details pane.
  • In the Home tab, the What's new section contains a list of new capabilities and changes to the BigQuery Studio.
  • The notebook action bar is consolidated by default to give you more screen space for writing code.
entry.summary: BigQuery Studio has been updated with several new features to improve usability and resource management. Key enhancements include a reorganized Explorer pane for streamlined resource discovery, a new search feature, consolidated job history access, and improved tab management for a cleaner workspace. These updates aim to enhance the overall user experience within BigQuery Studio.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery Studio Enhancements Now Available

entry.content: You can now access repositories by clicking Repositories in the Explorer pane. A new tab opens that displays a list of repositories. The Explorer pane no longer has a bottom pane for repositories. When you open a workspace in a repository, it opens in the Git repository pane in the left pane. These features are available in BigQuery Studio in preview.
entry.summary: Repositories can now be accessed by clicking 'Repositories' in the Explorer pane, opening a new tab with a list of repositories. The bottom pane for repositories has been removed from the Explorer pane. Workspaces within a repository now open in the Git repository pane in the left pane. These features are available in BigQuery Studio in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Repositories Accessible via Explorer Pane

entry.content: You can visualize your geospatial query results on an interactive map in BigQuery Studio. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Visualize your geospatial query results on an interactive map in BigQuery Studio.
entry.title: Feature: Geospatial query results visualization

entry.content: You can use the dbt-bigquery adapter to run Python code that's defined in BigQuery DataFrames. For more information, see Use BigQuery DataFrames in dbt. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now use the dbt-bigquery adapter to execute Python code defined in BigQuery DataFrames. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Run Python code in BigQuery using dbt

entry.content: You can now use SQL cells to write, edit, and run SQL queries on your BigQuery data directly from your notebooks. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now use SQL cells to write, edit, and run SQL queries on your BigQuery data directly from your notebooks. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: SQL cells in notebooks

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer API (bigquerydatatransfer.googleapis.com) is now enabled by default for every new Google Cloud project. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer API is now generally available and enabled by default for all new Google Cloud projects.
entry.title: Announcement: BigQuery Data Transfer API Now Enabled by Default

entry.content: You can now embed natural language as comments in existing SQL to refine and transform your code. This feature is preview.
entry.summary: Use natural language comments within your SQL code to refine and transform it. This new feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Natural Language SQL Comments

entry.content: You can allocate idle slots fairly across reservations within a single admin project. This ensures each reservation receives an approximately equal share of available capacity. This feature is now generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Idle slots can now be allocated fairly across reservations within a single admin project, ensuring each reservation gets an equal share of available capacity. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Fairness in slot allocation

entry.content: You can set a maximum slot limit for a reservation. You can configure the maximum reservation size when creating or updating a reservation. This feature is now generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now set a maximum slot limit for reservations, configuring the maximum reservation size during creation or update. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Maximum Slot Limit for Reservations Now GA

entry.content: Security, privacy, and compliance for Gemini in BigQuery details how customer data is protected and processed by Gemini in BigQuery.
entry.summary: Learn how customer data is protected and processed by Gemini in BigQuery.
entry.title: Announcement: Security, privacy, and compliance for Gemini in BigQuery

entry.content: An updated version of the ODBC driver for BigQuery is now available.
entry.summary: The latest version of the ODBC driver for BigQuery has been released.
entry.title: Changed: ODBC driver for BigQuery updated

entry.content: The default limit of QueryUsagePerDay for on-demand pricing has changed. The default limit of all new projects is now 200 TiB. For existing projects, the default limit has been set based on your project's usage over the last 30 days. Projects that have custom cost controls configured or that use reservations aren't affected. If the new limit might affect your workload, create a custom cost control based on your workload needs.
entry.summary: The default daily query limit for on-demand pricing has been raised to 200 TiB for new projects. Existing projects will have limits adjusted based on recent usage. This change does not affect projects with custom cost controls or reservations.
entry.title: Breaking: Daily Query Limit Increased

entry.content: You can set labels on reservations. These labels can be used to organize your reservations and for billing analysis. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now add labels to your reservations for better organization and billing analysis. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Reservation labels now available

entry.content: You can specify which reservation a query uses at runtime, and set IAM policies directly on reservations. This provides more flexibility and fine-grained control over resource management. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery now allows specifying which reservation a query uses at runtime and setting IAM policies directly on reservations. This offers greater flexibility and control over resource management. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Runtime query-to-reservation mapping and reservation-level IAM policies

entry.content: As of February 25, 2025, enhancements to the workload management autoscaler that were announced on July 31, 2024 have rolled out to all users. These enhancements are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The enhancements to the workload management autoscaler announced on July 31, 2024, are now generally available to all users as of February 25, 2025.
entry.title: Announcement: Workload Management Autoscaler Enhancements Now GA

entry.content:
The INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SHARED_DATASET_USAGE view now includes the following schema fields to support usage metrics for external tables and routines:

  • shared_resource_id: the ID of the queried resource
  • shared_resource_type: the type of the queried resource
  • referenced_tables: Contains project_id, dataset_id, table_id, and processed_bytes fields of the base table.

These fields are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The INFORMATION_SCHEMA.SHARED_DATASET_USAGE view now includes new schema fields (shared_resource_id, shared_resource_type, referenced_tables) to support usage metrics for external tables and routines. These fields are now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: New Usage Metrics for External Tables and Routines

entry.content: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer reporting data from Google Analytics 4 into BigQuery. You can also include custom reports from Google Analytics 4 in your data transfer. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports transferring data from Google Analytics 4, including custom reports, into BigQuery. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Google Analytics 4 data now transferable to BigQuery

entry.content:
The BigQuery Data Transfer Service can now transfer data from the following data sources:

  • PayPal
  • Stripe

Transfers from these data sources are supported in preview.
entry.summary: The BigQuery Data Transfer Service now supports data transfers from PayPal and Stripe in preview.
entry.title: Feature: New data sources supported in BigQuery Data Transfer Service

entry.content: You can now set the priority of BigQuery jobs initiated by Dataform workflows to run queries as interactive jobs that start running as quickly as possible or as batch jobs with lower priority. For more information, see Create a pipeline schedule and InvocationConfig. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now control the priority of BigQuery jobs run by Dataform. Choose between interactive jobs for faster starts or batch jobs for lower priority. This generally available feature helps optimize your data processing workflows.
entry.title: Feature: Dataform BigQuery job priorities

entry.content: Starting March 17, 2026, the BigQuery Data Transfer Service will require the bigquery.datasets.setIamPolicy and the bigquery.datasets.getIamPolicy permissions on the target dataset to create or update a transfer configuration. For more information, see Changes to dataset-level access controls.
entry.summary: Starting March 17, 2026, BigQuery Data Transfer Service will require new IAM permissions for transfers.
entry.title: Announcement: BigQuery Access Control Update

entry.content: You can now use the notebook gallery in the BigQuery web UI as your central hub for discovering and using prebuilt notebook templates. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Discover and use prebuilt notebook templates directly within the BigQuery web UI using the new Notebook Gallery, now in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Notebook Gallery Now Available in BigQuery

entry.content: You can now apply SQL query generated in the Gemini Cloud Assist chat to the query open in your editor. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now apply SQL queries generated in the Gemini Cloud Assist chat directly to your open query in the editor. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: SQL query from Gemini Cloud Assist now available in editor

entry.content: To simplify access management for your Iceberg tables, you can use credential vending mode with the Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore. Credential vending removes the need for catalog users to have direct access to Cloud Storage buckets. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Simplify access management for your Iceberg tables using credential vending mode with the Apache Iceberg REST catalog in BigLake metastore. This feature removes the need for catalog users to have direct access to Cloud Storage buckets.
entry.title: Feature: Access Management for Iceberg Tables

entry.content: You can now create BigQuery non-incremental materialized views over Spanner data to improve query performance by periodically caching results. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Improve query performance with new BigQuery materialized views over Spanner data. This feature, now in Preview, periodically caches results for faster querying.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery Materialized Views over Spanner Data

entry.content: BigQuery data preparation supports unnesting arrays, which expands each array element into its own row for easier analysis. For more information, see Unnest arrays. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery data preparation now supports unnesting arrays, turning each array element into its own row for simpler analysis. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Unnest arrays in BigQuery data prep

entry.content: History-based query optimizations are now enabled by default. If history-based optimizations have been previously disabled, you can re-enable history-based optimizations for your project or organization.
entry.summary: History-based query optimizations are now on by default. You can re-enable them if previously disabled.
entry.title: Announcement: History-based query optimizations enabled

entry.content: The ARRAY_FIRST, ARRAY_LAST, and ARRAY_SLICE GoogleSQL functions are now generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The ARRAY_FIRST, ARRAY_LAST, and ARRAY_SLICE GoogleSQL functions have reached general availability. These functions provide enhanced capabilities for working with array data.
entry.title: Feature: New Array Functions Now Generally Available

entry.content: BigQuery data canvas now supports destination table nodes. Destination table nodes let you persist query results to a new or existing table. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery data canvas now supports destination tables, allowing you to save query results to new or existing tables. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery data canvas now supports destination tables

entry.content: BigQuery ML now supports visualization of model monitoring metrics. This feature lets you use charts and graphs to analyze model monitoring function output. You can use metric visualization with the ML.VALIDATE_DATA_SKEW and ML.VALIDATE_DATA_DRIFT functions. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery ML now supports visualization of model monitoring metrics, allowing you to analyze model monitoring function output using charts and graphs. This feature is generally available and can be used with the ML.VALIDATE_DATA_SKEW and ML.VALIDATE_DATA_DRIFT functions.
entry.title: Feature: Model monitoring visualization now available

entry.content: For command-line users, BigQuery is now integrated with the Gemini CLI to provide an agentic CLI experience. Using the dedicated Gemini CLI extensions for BigQuery, you can search, explore, analyze, and gain insights from your data by asking natural language questions, generating forecasts, and running contribution analysis directly from the command line. This feature is available in beta.
entry.summary: BigQuery now offers an agentic CLI experience through integration with the Gemini CLI. This allows users to interact with their data using natural language commands for tasks like searching, analysis, and forecasting directly from the command line. This feature is currently in beta.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery Now Integrates with Gemini CLI

entry.content: You can now run federated queries against PostgreSQL dialect databases in Spanner using BigQuery external datasets with GoogleSQL; this includes cross-region federated queries. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now run federated queries against PostgreSQL dialect databases in Spanner using BigQuery external datasets with GoogleSQL. This feature is generally available and supports cross-region queries.
entry.title: Feature: Federated queries for PostgreSQL in Spanner are now available

entry.content:
Python

3.38.0 (2025-09-15)

Features
  • Add additional query stats (#2270) (7b1b718)
entry.summary: The latest Python BigQuery client library (v3.38.0) now includes additional query statistics, enhancing data analysis capabilities.
entry.title: Libraries: Python BigQuery Client Library v3.38.0

entry.content: You can now access snapshots of Apache Iceberg external tables that are retained in your Iceberg metadata by using the FOR SYSTEM_TIME AS OF clause. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Query historical data of external tables using the `FOR SYSTEM_TIME AS OF` clause.
entry.title: Feature: Access historical data of external tables

entry.content: You can use the JSON_KEYS function to extract unique JSON keys from a JSON expression, and you can specify a mode for some JSON functions that take a JSONPath to allow more flexibility in how the path matches the JSON structure. These features are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery's JSON_KEYS function and JSONPath mode are now generally available, offering enhanced flexibility for extracting JSON data.
entry.title: Feature: JSON Functions Now Generally Available

entry.content: SQL code completion is now available for all BigQuery projects. To learn how to enable and activate Gemini in BigQuery features, see Set up Gemini in BigQuery. This feature is available in preview.
entry.summary: SQL code completion is now available for all BigQuery projects. You can learn how to enable and activate Gemini in BigQuery features by visiting the Set up Gemini in BigQuery documentation. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: SQL code completion is now available for all BigQuery projects.

entry.content: In the BigQuery Studio, in the Explorer pane, you can now open saved queries in Connected Sheets. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now open saved queries directly within Connected Sheets from BigQuery Studio's Explorer pane. This new feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Saved Queries Now Available in Connected Sheets

entry.content: You can now enable the BigQuery advanced runtime to improve query execution time and slot usage. This feature is generally available (GA). Between September 15, 2025 and early 2026, the BigQuery advanced runtime will become the default runtime for all projects.
entry.summary: BigQuery's advanced runtime is now generally available, offering improved query execution time and slot usage. This feature will become the default for all projects between September 2025 and early 2026.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery Advanced Runtime Now Generally Available

entry.content: Use the BigQuery migration assessment for Informatica to assess the complexity of migrating data from your Informatica platform to BigQuery. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Use the BigQuery migration assessment for Informatica to assess the complexity of migrating data from your Informatica platform to BigQuery. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Assess Informatica to BigQuery Migration Complexity

entry.content: Gemini now recommends natural language prompts for you in the SQL generation tool. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Gemini now recommends natural language prompts for you in the SQL generation tool. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini SQL generation

entry.content: When you use the Data Science Agent in BigQuery, you can now use the Apache Spark or PySpark keywords in your prompt. The Data Science Agent is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now use Apache Spark or PySpark keywords with the BigQuery Data Science Agent.
entry.title: Feature: Apache Spark support in BigQuery Data Science Agent

entry.content: You can load files from Cloud Storage in BigQuery data preparations. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery data preparations now allow loading files from Cloud Storage. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Load data from GCS to BigQuery

entry.content: The batch and interactive translators now caches your metadata, which can improve latency when you run a SQL translation. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The SQL translators now cache metadata to improve latency. This feature is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: SQL Translation Caching

entry.content: You can now perform supervised tuning on a BigQuery ML remote model based on a Vertex AI gemini-2.5-pro or gemini-2.5-flash-lite model.
entry.summary: Supervised tuning is now available for BigQuery ML remote models using Vertex AI's gemini-2.5-pro and gemini-2.5-flash-lite models.
entry.title: Changed: Supervised Tuning for Remote Models

entry.content: You can configure reusable, default Cloud resource connections in a project. Default connections are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Default resource connections are now generally available. You can configure reusable, default connections in your project.
entry.title: Feature: Default connections are now generally available

entry.content: You can now add tables and views as tasks to BigQuery pipelines. For more information, see Add a pipeline task. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now add tables and views as tasks to BigQuery pipelines. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Add tables and views to BigQuery pipelines

entry.content: When you use the Data Science Agent in BigQuery, you can now use the @ symbol to search for BigQuery tables in your project, and you can use the + symbol to search for files to upload. The Data Science Agent is in Preview.
entry.summary: The Data Science Agent in BigQuery now supports '@' to search for tables and '+' to upload files. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: New shortcuts for Data Science Agent

entry.content: You can now include table parameters when you create a table-valued function (TVF). This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now include table parameters when creating a TVF. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Table-valued functions with parameters now in Preview

entry.content: BigQuery now supports soft failover with managed disaster recovery. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports managed disaster recovery for soft failover, which is now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery Managed Disaster Recovery

entry.content: You can flatten records in BigQuery data preparation with a single operation. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: You can now flatten records in BigQuery data preparation with a single operation. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Flatten Records Now Available

entry.content: The INFORMATION_SCHEMA.RESERVATIONS_TIMELINE view now includes the per_second_details schema field. This new field provides information regarding reservation capacity and usage on a per-second basis, and also includes details on autoscale utilization. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The INFORMATION_SCHEMA.RESERVATIONS_TIMELINE view now includes the per_second_details schema field. This new field provides information regarding reservation capacity and usage on a per-second basis, and also includes details on autoscale utilization.
entry.title: Feature: Per-second reservation details now available

entry.content:
You can now create a remote model based on an open embedding model from Vertex Model Garden or Hugging Face that is deployed to Vertex AI. Options include E5 Embedding and other leading open embedding generation models. You can then use the ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING function with this remote model to generate embeddings.

Try this feature with the Generate text embeddings by using an open model and the ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING function tutorial.

This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now create a remote model based on open embedding models from Vertex Model Garden or Hugging Face deployed to Vertex AI. Use the ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING function with this remote model to generate embeddings. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Create remote models with open embedding models

entry.content: You can now create a remote model based on the Vertex AI gemini-embedding-001 model. You can then use the ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING function with this remote model to generate embeddings. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery now supports creating remote models with Vertex AI's gemini-embedding-001. Use ML.GENERATE_EMBEDDING to create text embeddings. This feature is in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: New remote model for embeddings

entry.content: You can now reference BigQuery ML and DataFrames in your prompts when you use the Data Science Agent in a BigQuery notebook. The Data Science Agent is in Preview.
entry.summary: The Data Science Agent in BigQuery notebooks now supports referencing BigQuery ML and DataFrames in prompts.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery ML and DataFrames Integration

entry.content: You can now configure listings for multiple regions for shared datasets and linked dataset replicas in BigQuery sharing. For more information, see Create a listing. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: BigQuery sharing now supports configuring multi-region listings for shared datasets and linked dataset replicas. This feature is currently in preview.
entry.title: Feature: Configure multi-region listings for BigQuery datasets

entry.content: You can now enable the automatic selection of a processing location in your pipeline configurations. For more information, see Create pipelines. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: The pipeline configuration now supports automatic selection of a processing location. This feature is generally available.
entry.title: Feature: Automatic processing location selection

entry.content:
Go

1.70.0 (2025-08-28)

Features
  • bigquery/reservation: Add Reservation.max_slots field to Reservation proto, indicating the total max number of slots this reservation can use up to (f1de706)
  • bigquery/reservation: Add Reservation.scaling_mode field and its corresponding enum message ScalingMode. This field should be used together with Reservation.max_slots (f1de706)
  • bigquery/storage/managedwriter: Allow overriding proto conversion mapping (#12579) (ce9d29b), refs #12578
  • bigquery: Add load/extract job completion ratio (#12471) (3dab483)
  • bigquery: Load job and external table opts for custom time format, null markers and source column match (#12470) (67b0320)
entry.summary: This release introduces significant enhancements to the Go libraries, including new fields for Reservation proto to manage slot capacity and scaling, improved proto conversion mapping in managed writer, and added options for load and extract jobs to handle custom time formats and null markers.
entry.title: Libraries: New features for Go libraries

entry.summary: Query templates are now available to predefine and limit queries in data clean rooms, enhancing security and control. This feature is currently in preview.

entry.content: You can deduplicate table data with Gemini assistance in your BigQuery data preparations. Deduplication is in Preview.
entry.summary: Deduplicate your BigQuery table data with Gemini assistance. This feature is currently in Preview.

entry.content: You can use the ST_REGIONSTATS geography function to combine raster data using Earth Engine with your vector data stored in BigQuery. For more information, see Work with raster data and try the tutorial that shows you how to use raster data to analyze global temperature. This feature is generally available.

entry.content: You can now use data insights to have Gemini generate table and column descriptions from table metadata. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Gemini can now generate table and column descriptions from table metadata using data insights. This feature is now generally available.

entry.content:
Starting September 25, 2025, the BigQuery Data Transfer Service for third-party SAAS and database connectors will update to a consumption-based pricing model. With this new pricing model, you will be charged based on the compute resources consumed by your data transfers, measured in slot-hours. For more information, see Data Transfer Service pricing. This pricing update applies to the following third-party connectors when they are generally available (GA):

  • Facebook Ads
  • MySQL
  • Oracle
  • PostgreSQL
  • Salesforce
  • Salesforce Marketing Cloud
  • ServiceNow
  • Other third-party connectors planned for future releases
entry.summary: BigQuery Data Transfer Service pricing update for third-party connectors.
entry.title: Announcement: Pricing Update

entry.content:
In the BigQuery console, you can now use the Reference panel to do the following:

  • In the query editor, you can use the Reference panel to preview the schema details of tables, snapshots, views, and materialized views, or open these resources in a new tab. You can also use the panel to construct new queries or edit existing queries by inserting query snippets or field names.
  • In the notebook editor, you can use the Reference panel to preview the schema details of tables, snapshots, views, or materialized views, or open these resources in a new tab.

This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Preview schema details and construct queries using the Reference panel in BigQuery.
entry.title: Feature: Reference Panel Now Available in BigQuery

entry.content: When you use the Data Science Agent in BigQuery, you can now use the table selector to choose one or more BigQuery tables to analyze. The Data Science Agent is in Preview.
entry.summary: Easily select BigQuery tables for analysis with the Data Science Agent.
entry.title: Feature: New Table Selector for BigQuery Data Science Agent

entry.content: You can now visualize your geospatial query results on an interactive map in BigQuery studio. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Visualize your geospatial query results on an interactive map.
entry.title: Feature: Geospatial Visualization

entry.content: You can use cross region federated queries to query Spanner tables from regions other than the source BigQuery region. These cross region queries incur additional Spanner network egress charges. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Cross-region queries for Spanner are now available.
entry.title: Feature: New Spanner feature

entry.content: You can aggregate table data with Gemini assistance in your BigQuery data preparations. Aggregations in data preparations are in Preview.
entry.summary: Aggregate table data with Gemini assistance.
entry.title: Feature: Feature Announcement

entry.content: You can now save query results to Cloud Storage. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Query results can now be saved to Cloud Storage.
entry.title: Feature: New Cloud Storage Feature

entry.content: BigQuery resource utilization charts are generally available (GA).
entry.summary: BigQuery resource utilization charts are now generally available.
entry.title: Feature: BigQuery resource utilization charts

entry.content: You can now use WITH expressions in your GoogleSQL queries to create temporary variables. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Use WITH expressions for temporary variables.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: WITH expressions

entry.content: You can now use chained function call syntax in GoogleSQL to make deeply nested function calls easier to read. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Easily read nested function calls with chained function syntax.
entry.title: Feature: Chained Function Calls Now Available

entry.content: BigQuery data preparations are now represented in the SQLX format and in the pipe query syntax to simplify the CI/CD code review process. For more information, see Manage data preparations.
entry.summary: BigQuery data preparations are now in SQLX format and pipe query syntax.
entry.title: Changed: Updated BigQuery Data Preparations

entry.content: Enabling the advanced runtime now includes short query optimizations. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Short query optimizations are now available with advanced runtime.
entry.title: Feature: New feature available

entry.summary: Java BigQuery client library updates.
entry.title: Libraries: Java BigQuery Updates

entry.content: You can now use the new Data Science Agent (DSA) for Colab Enterprise and BigQuery to automate exploratory data analysis, perform machine learning tasks, and deliver insights all within a Colab Enterprise notebook. This feature is in preview.
entry.summary: Automate data analysis and machine learning tasks in Colab Enterprise.
entry.title: Feature: New Data Science Agent for Colab Enterprise

entry.content: You can manage data profile scans and data quality scans across your project by using the Metadata curation page in the Google Cloud console. For more information, see Profile your data and Scan for data quality issues. This feature is generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Manage data scans on the Metadata curation page.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Data Scan Management

entry.content:
BigQuery ML has improved throughput by more than 100x for the following generative AI functions:

  • ML.GENERATE_TEXT
  • AI.GENERATE_TABLE
  • AI.GENERATE
  • AI.GENERATE_BOOL
  • AI.GENERATE_DOUBLE
  • AI.GENERATE_INT

Actual performance varies based on the number of input and output tokens in the request, but a typical 6-hour job can now process millions of rows. For more information, see Generative AI functions.
entry.summary: BigQuery ML boosts generative AI function throughput by over 100x.
entry.title: Changed: Improved BigQuery ML Performance

entry.content: BigQuery ML now can automatically detect model quota increases in Vertex AI, and automatically adjusts the quota for any BigQuery ML functions that use those models. You no longer need to email the BigQuery ML team to increase model quota.
entry.summary: BigQuery ML now automatically detects and adjusts model quotas in Vertex AI, eliminating the need to contact the BigQuery ML team for increases.
entry.title: Changed: BigQuery ML Model Quota Updates

entry.content: You can now use continuous queries to export BigQuery data to Spanner in real time. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Real-time data export to Spanner with continuous queries.
entry.title: Feature: Real-time Spanner Exports

entry.content: The Gemini for Google Cloud API (cloudaicompanion.googleapis.com) is now enabled by default for most BigQuery projects. Exceptions include projects where customers have opted out, and those linked to accounts based in EMEA regions including BigQuery Europe, Middle East, and Africa regions.
entry.summary: Gemini for Google Cloud is now enabled by default for most BigQuery projects.
entry.title: Announcement: Gemini for Google Cloud in BigQuery

entry.content:

8.1.1 (2025-07-23)

entry.title: Libraries: Client Library Updates

entry.content: You can now associate data policies directly on columns. This feature enables direct database administration for controlling access and applying masking and transformation rules at the column level. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Data policies can now be associated directly on columns for database administration, access control, and masking/transformation rules.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Column-level data policies

entry.content: You can now use the VECTOR_INDEX.STATISTICS function to calculate how much an indexed table's data has drifted between when a vector index was created and the present. If table data has changed enough to require a vector index rebuild, you can use the ALTER VECTOR INDEX REBUILD statement to rebuild the vector index. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Check vector index data drift and rebuild if necessary.
entry.title: Feature: New Feature: Vector Index Monitoring

entry.content: Access Transparency supports BigQuery data preparation in the GA stage.
entry.summary: Access Transparency now supports BigQuery data preparation.
entry.title: Feature: Access Transparency for BigQuery

entry.content:
The CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE and LOAD DATA statements now support the following options in Preview:

  • null_markers: define the strings that represent NULL values in CSV files.
  • source_column_match: specify how loaded columns are matched to the schema. You can match columns by position or by name.
entry.summary: New options for CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE and LOAD DATA
entry.title: Feature: New options available

entry.content: You can now use the MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause in your SQL queries to filter and aggregate matches across rows in a table. This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: Filter and aggregate matches across rows using the MATCH_RECOGNIZE clause.
entry.title: Feature: New SQL Feature
